docs.lead_paragraph: BETTERTON, MD. -- This small town still sits unpretentiously on the upper Eastern Shore side of Chesapeake Bay at the mouth of the Sassafras River. It generously calls itself a summer resort, but paint is peeling noticeably from the squeaky, old buildings.

docs.snippet: ON THE RHINE. AMERICANS are once again visiting the Rhine in large numbers. In fact, their numbers this year have been almost up to pre-war strength. But the majority see it so fleetingly that they barely get an inkling of the great beauty of the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: ON THE RHINE. AMERICANS are once again visiting the Rhine in large numbers. In fact, their numbers this year have been almost up to pre-war strength. But the majority see it so fleetingly that they barely get an inkling of the great beauty of the real Rhine the Rhine of the robber barons, whose castles often in ruins, still dot the banks of Europe's most beautiful river.
docs.abstract: Feature article, Once more the Rhine lures tourists, illus

headline.main: ONCE MORE THE RHINE LURES TOURISTS; But Many Fail to Grasp the Beauty of the Historic River As They Dash Past Storied Castles in Express Boats ONCE MORE THE RHINE LURES

docs.snippet: LEAD: RECENTLY I found myself fondling a dollar bill of such limp antiquity that it called the entire concept of cash into question. This tattered, pale greenback had been in circulation since the late 60's, but were it not for its privileged isol...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: RECENTLY I found myself fondling a dollar bill of such limp antiquity that it called the entire concept of cash into question. This tattered, pale greenback had been in circulation since the late 60's, but were it not for its privileged isolation on the island of Cuba, it would long ago have been incinerated.

headline.main: Crumbling Cuba Still Loves to Rumba
